author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: أَيْ رَبِّ لا تَمْنَعْنِي عَمَّا قَدَّرْتَهُ لإِمائِكَ اللاَّئِي يَطُفْنَ فِيْ حَوْلِكَ وَيَتَجَلَّى عَلَيْهِنَّ فِيْ كُلِّ حِينٍ شَمْسُ جَمالِكَ وَأَنْوارُ وَجْهِكَ، إِنَّكَ لَمْ تَزَلْ كُنْتَ مُعِينَ مَنْ أَرادَكَ وَمُعْطِيَ مَنْ سَئَلَكَ،
translation: Withhold not from me, O my Lord, the things Thou didst ordain for such of Thy handmaidens as circle around Thee, and on whom are poured continually the splendors of the sun of Thy beauty and the beams of the brightness of Thy face. Thou art He Who from everlasting hath succored whosoever hath sought Thee, and bountifully favored him who hath asked Thee.
